timeline.bodyText: I think you can return Long directly and the caller should check whether it's null.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Is this resolved now?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: I decided that it makes most sense to check that a filename is valid in the create method of the AzureBlobStoreFileSystem, where a new file is created.  In the create method, the getBlobOutputStream() method will throw a BlobStorageException if a filename is invalid.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: How do we pick up the number 8640000  here? If it should be a constant, we can make it as static final.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: This is a typo, I meant 86400000. 86,400,000 millis = 1 day.  I can make it a final constant.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: Please have a class-level javadoc to explain what the class is for.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Can you elaborate more on the error msg? Like the pattern should be wildcard?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Duration.ofMinutes(1)
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Please make the error message specific.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Why is it an UnsupportedOperationException ? Under what kind of condition the blobContainerClient.exists() will be false?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: The operation is unsupported because the user is trying to create a file in a container that doesn't exist, and I made a design decision that the create method does not recursively create containers, it only creates files within containers that already exist.  I can change this to a FileNotFoundException stating that the container doesn't exist if that is more intuitive.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: Can we make the constant string racwdlup  and co  as static final attribute of the class?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: Sure, done.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: Please make the comment as the javadoc.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: It seems like you have already separated the Azure options and Blob options.

timeline.bodyText: is it possible to have blob == null and also container == null so that it's an account?
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: (it seems like it's not possible, so feel free to ignore the comment if that's correct)
replies.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: It says in the javadoc for ResourceId.java that a resource id represents a file-like resource, so AzfsResourceId does not support resource id's without a container.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: I see that this code is duplicated in other filesystems. Would you be willing to move this to something like FileSystemUtils.java to live right next to FileSystem.java and remove the duplicated code from other places? (this can be done as part of a follow-up PR, but can you file a JIRA ticket to track it?)
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: Sure, I filed a ticket at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10758.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: it's not that important, but name here contains only the blob name, right? Can you include the container and account in the log?
timeline.author: pabloem

timeline.bodyText: What happens if there are no matches whatsoever? I guess results would be empty and that's it?
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: I looked into this and it seems that it depends on the EmptyMatchTreatment used in the Filesystems::match call.  See https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/fs/EmptyMatchTreatment.java.  So in the case where there are no matches, I can either return MatchResult.create(MatchResult.Status.OK, results) or MatchResult.create(MatchResult.Status.NOT_FOUND, new FileNotFoundException()), and these two options will be treated in the same way at https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/FileSystems.java#L159-L160.  So I can leave the code as is, unless the second option is more readable.
replies.author: ettirapp

replies.bodyText: perfect. thanks!
replies.author: pabloem

timeline.bodyText: For line 133 and 134 Can you add something like "Internal error encountered in AzureBlobStoreFileSystem: Expect no more elements in ..." ?
timeline.author: pabloem

timeline.bodyText: Should this be i-1? or should it actually be i+1? I understand this code comes from elsewhere (thus it's a good idea to standardize and make it a utility) - can you add a unit test with a file pattern containing a backslash at the end to see what happens?
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: As we discussed, there seems to be an error in this method, but we will resolve it in a follow-up PR.

timeline.bodyText: These configuration-related variables seem to be non-serializable. I think we need to implement the special Json serializer before moving forward with adding these changes. We can remove these changes from this PR (and rely purely on a String-type connectionString) and add them in a follow-up PR, or get the Json serializer in this PR. What do you think?
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: I was planning to implement a module similar to AwsModule to serialize the non-serializable variables.  I can include it in this PR, I'll work on it today.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.bodyText: this comment is more related to the options classes, but you can add this annotation to AzureOptions and BlobstoreOptions, so that we will be able to move options around. As discussed in person, when in doubt about where to put an option, err on the side of caution, and put them in BlobstoreOptions.
timeline.author: pabloem

timeline.bodyText: I recommend you remove all the LOG.info lines from this class. Because there may be 100s or 1000s of AzureReadableSeekableByteChannel objects in a Beam pipeline, this logging may overwhelm the logging system
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: Got it, will do.
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.message: removing logger from azure bytechannel

timeline.bodyText: The Environment Configuration property is failing to serialize, and thus it's preventing me from running the pipeline on DirectRunner. We can work around this by writing a custom JSON serializer (like in S3). But maybe we can remove environmentConfiguration for now and add it on a later change?
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: Sure, I'll remove it
replies.author: ettirapp

timeline.message: removed non-serializable option
removed non-serializable configuration option

timeline.bodyText: Please file a JIRA issue to track this.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this test suite is necessary for IT since test cases here should be covered by the unit tests already. I would image the IT we want is a a pipeline reading from azure file system and writing to azure file system. @pabloem what do you think?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: Yes, the integration tests are a work in progress.  I put these tests here in case I ended up needing any of them later, but I can move them out of this PR since they aren't being used now.  Thanks for reviewing everything!
replies.author: ettirapp

replies.bodyText: I agree. We only need a configuration in a build.gradle file that runs WordCount from an azfs:// file.
